heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 08 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1737 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 10.2°C), outside temperature (down 8.9°C), and inside temperature (down 3.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 7140 lux) and cloud levels (up 503 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 7596 lux) and cloud levels (up 481 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 503.2m lower than yesterday, 357.8m lower than the past week, 480.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 993m minimum and 2630m maximum, with an average of 1119.3m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1477.1m and 1600.0m.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, dry and less humid conditions and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and overcast conditions will limit sunlight. Weather should be calm and steady.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (5.0°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
